front.title: Specification Alternate Tunnel Information for Data Frames in WLAN

abstract.t: In IEEE 802.11 Wireless Local Area Network (WLAN) architecture, in order to meet the scalability requirement, customer data frames are desired to be distributed to an endpoint (e.g. Access Router AR) different from the Access Controller (AC). For tunneling the data frames, there are many known alternate tunnel technologies can be used, such as IP-GRE, IP-IP, CAPWAP, L2TP/L2TPv3 etc. To assist a WTP to set up the alternate tunnels, this document extends the message elements to report WTP the specific alternate tunnel information.
